div.ab: A good water for all sight(?) of the eye: Take a glassâ€“full [of] rose oil water and a half-glass with white wine and a half ounce of tuzia parparta, and a scruple of (???) , and a skin of (???), and mix it very fully in an angster (some sort of vessel), and put some of the water in an eye. So will he be healed, certainly, from this.

One who has ice in the eyes: he must take (???) and salvia (sage) and saffron and the white from an egg ad mix it all together and make a salve out of it. And take from the same salve and put it on the ice(?). So will he be hot and it will melt, certainly.
